title: How to Make Gluten Free Graham Crackers

steps.headline: Cut two sheets of parchment paper the same size as your baking sheets.
In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the gluten-free all purpose flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.
Cut the butter into the flour mixture until it is evenly crumbly.
In a separate bowl, mix the honey and the milk, stirring until the honey is dissolved.
Add the honey and milk mixture to the gluten free flour mixture and toss lightly with a fork until the dough comes together.
Turn out the dough onto a surface floured with gluten free flour.
Divide the dough in half.
steps.description: Roll one half of the dough out onto the first piece of parchment in a 10 x 14 inch rectangle. The dough should be about ⁄16 inch (0.2 cm) thick.

steps.headline: Trim the edges and prick dough evenly with a dough docker or fork.
Use a pizza cutter to cut the dough into 16 rectangles.
steps.description: This will provide the separations that you usually find in graham crackers. Place the parchment onto the baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, or until they are a medium golden color.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and let cool.
steps.description: Once the crackers have cooled, break them apart at the separations.

steps.headline: Repeat with the rest of the dough.

text: Preheat the oven to 325 °F (163 °C).  Cut two sheets of parchment paper the same size as your baking sheets.  In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the gluten-free all purpose flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  Cut the butter into the flour mixture until it is evenly crumbly.  In a separate bowl, mix the honey and the milk, stirring until the honey is dissolved.  Add the honey and milk mixture to the gluten free flour mixture and toss lightly with a fork until the dough comes together. Add additional milk, if necessary. Turn out the dough onto a surface floured with gluten free flour. Fold the dough until smooth. Divide the dough in half. Roll one half of the dough out onto the first piece of parchment in a 10 x 14 inch rectangle. The dough should be about ⁄16 inch (0.2 cm) thick. Trim the edges and prick dough evenly with a dough docker or fork.  Use a pizza cutter to cut the dough into 16 rectangles. This will provide the separations that you usually find in graham crackers. Place the parchment onto the baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, or until they are a medium golden color. Remove from the oven and let cool. Once the crackers have cooled, break them apart at the separations. Repeat with the rest of the dough.  Finished.
